Reviews.Title: “As close to Home-Sweet-Home as it gets!”
Reviews.Author: KRBStay
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Daytona's Extended Stay Deluxe Hotel. My seven-day visit unexpectedly turned into eighteen days. As hard as it was being away from home, Doug, Diane, Martha, Grace and all of the wonderful staff made me feel very comfortable and were extremely helpful. With such a long stay, the amenities became necessities: laundry room, work-out room; pool and best of all the use of the 'community' printer for my business needs. I will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Diane West”
Reviews.Author: reginald s
Reviews.Content: I was at your hotel for one night and my experience was wonderful.I cant speak enough about how Ms. Diane West catered to our every need. She showed genuine care towards her customers. She made me feel good about the choice I made to stay at this hotel. I will surely be back. Diane I thank you for having the pleasure of meeting you, hope I see you on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: HSLilAce
Reviews.Content: I was expecting more from a hotel-type business. I should have known that they would be more like a short-stay apartment complex than a hotel. Upon arriving at my room the door was ajar, held open by the security latch by housekeeping (kind of a security issue here). When I requested for extra pillows and a wash cloth, I was told to come downstairs to pick them up instead of having housekeeping bring them to my room. On a good note, the staff was very friendly and the beds and rooms were clean. The bar stools weren't exactly the best, but we didn't mind during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay in an extended stay”
Reviews.Author: JC0485
Reviews.Content: My friends and I decided to stay a night in this type of "extended-stay" hotel. The rate was really good (sub $80 range) during a non-event weekend. Expect a sizable rate hike during a NASCAR/racing event. The amenities provided in the room were really good, which are in place because it's made for staying longer than a few days. An oversize slide closet was provided, one room bathroom that included a toilet, bathtub and sink. The TV was a flat screen 32 inch, in the TV stand cabinet is a DVD player. A study desk with a lamp was also in the room but I thought it was in a terrible position since it's right next to the AC unit. I was exposed to regular blasts of cold air when I sat there. There's a walk-in kitchen with counters/stools, cabinets, pull-out drawers with clean stainless steel utensils, ceramic plates, coffee maker, a microwave and a full-size refrigerator. There were six of us. We stayed in a two queen bed room. The room included a couch with a pull out bed. The couch did have some dark stains on it. Some negligible stains in the bathtub, but overall the bathroom was clean. No weird smells. Extra blankets and pillows we needed were provided, but we had to go to the front desk to pick them up. Mind you, room service is limited.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KEWPIE_10
Reviews.Content: Only stayed the one night, bit the room was ready upon arrival, very spacious, clean; bed was comfortable. Overnight was very quiet on race weekend. Perfect for any stay, but outstanding for a race weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: krsquared
Reviews.Content: Staying in Daytona Beach right in the middle of the fun areas is great! Great service and wonderful staff, clean rooms. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Janine S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Extended Stay Deluxe for several days and had the most comfortable and clean rooms ever. The kitchen area was spacious with everything I needed. The beds were very large and comfortable. Everything was clean and neat. The staff was the best that I have ever experienced. I would stay at another Extended Stay Deluxe anytime. This hotel was located near many restaurants and malls.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kim B
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here with husband and 2 daughters. Staff is very friendly and very helpful. Rooms very spacious, clean and comfy. Full kitchen is sooo handy. Nice pool...with outside bathrooms. Located walking distance to very nice mall...it's literally behind hotel and lots of other shopping right in the area...it's in a great location. Daytona beach is 10 minute drive. We would highly recommend and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: D M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times and always enjoy Doug and the whole staff. They are always helpful and very professional. The room are very comfortable and clean. I will not be going to another hotel as long as I continue to come to Daytona Beach for business. Thank you Doug and staff for the pleasant stay as always.

Reviews.Title: “My Long Stay At Extended Stay Delux.”
Reviews.Author: Mahmoud N
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property twice.Each time for about six month.Highly recommended for individuals and families.The rates are very good,the Manager and the rest of his staff are friendly,efficient and helpful.Rooms are well equied and clean. I look forward to coming back. M.M.Nashar

Reviews.Title: “my extended stay review”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence M
Reviews.Content: spent four nights there (Thur-Sun) left on Monday morning. Room was very well maintained and clean. Staff was very helpful during our stay, From Doug (the manager) down to the ones cleaning the rooms. I will be looking to book my stays with Extended Stay in other cities I travel to in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Secure, Quiet, Affordable, Clean, Friendly, Accomodating and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Karen K
Reviews.Content: Our situation was not the best, we were relocating and looking for a permanent home for us and our pets. Doug, the manager and Martha his assistant were great and welcomed us to the area. Always freindly and ready to accomodate any needs. Our relocation was made much easier because we knew, when back at the hotel all would be fine... It became "home" to us for 45 days. We would recommend the friendly atmoshpere, managment and staff along with the convenient location to all. We close on our new home tomorrow! Thanks Doug and Martha Mick and Karen K Boston, MA

Reviews.Title: “WOUNDERFUL STAY!”
Reviews.Author: kathy o
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place where we could stay for a month and have everything we would need. All the staff was so helpfull with everything. Doug and Martha was great! We were there over Daytona 500 and Bike Week they handled it fine.It is 2 blocks from Daytona 500 and 10 minutes from the beach,great location.We will be back next year. Enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay. Gets better everytime we visit.”
Reviews.Author: BJD1950
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the third time in a year for the Daytona 500 for 12 days. Once again another great stay. Great location, quiet, and clean. The manager, Doug and new assistant manager Martha are WONDERFUL. They make sure all of your needs are met and the total staff are extremely friendly and will do all they can to help. We will stay here again when we visit Daytona Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Andrew S
Reviews.Content: The price for this hotel was right.. Most of the reviews for this were spot on. The staff were excellent. I left me key in the door, and the manager found it during rounds and held it for me, when I asked the next day and he had it...we both laughed at me forgetfulness. They were friendly and attentive. The room was clean and neat...the worst thing I saw was some damage at the bottom of the bathroom vanity and a little peeling paint above the shower due to a sprinkle from the shower...other than that everything was excellent. The track is right..and I mean right across the street. I could here the cars going around the track. But, not loud enough to distract. I would definitively stay again. Thanks again to all the friendly staff...awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay again”
Reviews.Author: BJD1950
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a second time this year for the Coke 400 for 8 days. Great location, quiet, and great staff again saw to our needs. I discovered to my dismay when we returned home that I had left our bathing suits, beach towels and a sweat shirt in the hotel. Called the hotel and spoke with Doug, who looked for the items, found them and then had Mary ship them back to us AT NO CHARGE. This hotel staff again went above and beyond to take care of our needs. We will be returning to this hotel again and wouldn't consider staying anywhere else when we return in Feb. 2012. Thanks again for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: ChefHawk
Reviews.Content: So if you are in Daytona Beach and are on a budget, it is an okay place to stay. Don't expect much and you will not be disappointed. The room was clean. My only complaint was the exhaust fan over the stove and in the bathroom didn't work and they will only allow 2 rolls of toliet paper per week without a charge. Bring your own everything and you will be okay. Like I said, basic accomdations.

Reviews.Title: “Great place A+”
Reviews.Author: vettefun2000
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. I will be back!!! Quiet,close to race track and the beach! The staff was very helpfull and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Buckeye460
Reviews.Content: The Extended Stay Deluxe web-page is your best bet for the lowest price here. I saved $20 per nite ($54.00 total) by joining their promotional frequent traveler program. I had also called the hotel so I am positive of the savings. The suite I had was an open concept unit. Queen Bed, pull out sofa bed and full kitchen. Good: Pet friendly with ample grassy area to walk doggie. Nice pool. Newer towels and sheets. FULL size kitchen. Bad: Carpets need replaced. Bed is NOT a pillow-top and I woke with a back-ache. Had to purchase cleaning solution and clean the coffee stains from the kitchen sink, the wall behind the kitchen sink as well as the bathroom sink area and bathtub (had hairs in them). No dishwasher and no dishsoap provided. The room was musty smelling. As per our little doggie, other dogs must have urinated in various areas in the room. (so much for the "extra cleaning" fee's when you book with a pet) I stayed on a weekend so there was no special amenities such as a breakfast. There is no daily housekeeping and the room shows it. As I mentioned, numerous areas not up to par with a "DELUXE" version of Extended Stay. The front desk person was pleasant enough, but really didn't fill me in, even where the pool was located. I also saw a woman walking down the hall that appear to be medicated or otherwise impaired when I first was checking into my room. Kinda scary with a "cheap" long-term housing type hotel. I have knowledge that people just coming out of prison(on parole etc) sometimes stay at these cheap long-term hotels. The Homewood Suites, (almost next door) is much nicer, more deluxe "suite" choice in the area, but you will pay 2 or 3 times more for the room, even when there are no races at Daytona Speedway. However, it IS much, much nicer, cleaner and more comfortable. I would go back but only because of the price. I think in this case you DO get what you paid for. (Please keep in mind, during races and events I would never stay here because you will be paying $200 a nite for a piece of crap room)

Reviews.Title: “Extended Stay hotels are always my hotel of choice - nothing compares for the money!”
Reviews.Author: PAHarleyGal
Reviews.Content: This chain of hotels is absolutely the best bang for the buck. The rooms are large enough to be comfortable when spending an evening in or returning from the activities of the day. The fridge is full size so there's plenty of room for food and drink. I don't want to pay a fortune for a room where I'm only going to relax and sleep - that's money I can spend elsewhere. Love it, love it, love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Janet3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It shares a parking lot with the mall! The staff was very nice and went above and beyond to make us feel at home. It was great to have a kitchen ecspecially since we were away from our family for Thanksgiving. The hotel was spotless. It was too cold to swim but we did enjoy hanging out by the pool. We were very pleasantly suprised (rate was very good and the hotel even better!)! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place unless you mind waking up with bug bites!”
Reviews.Author: Connie B
Reviews.Content: The room was great. The breakfast was bad ~ just some donuts and muffins. However, when I woke up the next day I was covered in bug bites. I never went to the pool, so I wasn't outside to get bit. I only stayed in my room and was studying. I liked the place, except for this fact. I won't stay again. The good just don't outweigh the bad.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and affordable for longterm stays”
Reviews.Author: Manatee3
Reviews.Content: Waiting for our house to be available; we are booked here for 3-months. Secure, clean, friendly, and comfortable. Staff is wonderful. Pet friendly with nice areas to walk your dog. Maintenance issues (few) addressed immediately. No complaints, only compliments.

Reviews.Title: “The best value in Daytona Beach.”
Reviews.Author: msconvention
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this facility many times and are always met with a warm welcome and great efficiency of check in and check out. All questions are answered and any request met with professionalism. When traveling alone, I always feel safe. The facility is well-lit---even on those late evenings after working. The corridors are pleasant and do not have the odd cooking odors as we have experienced in other facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Home on the road”
Reviews.Author: omega1FtLauderdale
Reviews.Content: Very clean, loved haveing full kitchen. staff ready to please.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional Staff”
Reviews.Author: nadradt
Reviews.Content: A situation occurred where housekeeping knocked on the door, and upon opening, a woman advised me (without even a greeting), "YOU CAN'T BE LEAVING YOUR TOWELS AND GARBAGE OUTSIDE THE DOOR." I was taken aback because I had left the items there when housekeeping was outside of my door cleaning other rooms (they never knocked on my door). I didn't know there was anything wrong with that since they were right there. I repeated what she said to me and told her that I didn't know the policy and didn't appreciate the way she approached me. She apparently went down to the front desk to say that I yelled at her, and the lady at the front desk called me and without even asking me what happened, stated, "YOU CAN'T TALK TO OUR EMPLOYEES THAT WAY." After failed attempts at correcting the front desk lady about the appropriate way to approach me with the situation, she threatened to have me removed from the property! I couldn't believe it! I was there without my husband and with 2 children under 3! The front desk lady also told me that if I didn't like the way they ran the hotel, then I can call the hotel manager and tell her how to run her hotel! This was so unprofessional it was beyond intelligent comprehension. The supervisor on duty took the phone away from the front desk lady after she started threatening to throw me out (thank God; it was Easter, too). He was very professional and actually listened to me tell him all the FACTS of the situation and he apologized for the way I was talked to by the housekeeper. As a flight attendant, I deal with delivering bad news on a regular basis, and I basically explained to him (the supervisor) that the housekeeper would have gotten a much better reaction if she had of said something like, "Good afternoon, ma'am! I notice that you have your garbage/towels here at the the door. I just want to advise you (quote the policy). I'll be more than happy to take the garbage and towels now (advise where the garbage and towels should be taken in the future)..." This would have been the best way to handle the situation without offending anyone. Just keep it professional and highly objective! I do appreciate the supervisor taking the time to try to ease the tension, however I was on vacation and just didn't feel comfortable so I moved to a different hotel...essentially double paying for the night. For peach of mind, however, it was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good bargain”
Reviews.Author: Rick355
Reviews.Content: For a bargain-priced hotel it's a great deal. The location is really good next to the Volusia mall, a couple restaurants and right down the street from the Daytona Speedway. The room layout is nice with this hotel chain, with a full mini-kitchen and recliner. It's also apparently recently renovated so my room at least was nice and clean. The downsides are the bath towels are small and thin, the internet you have to pay for and it's really slow wireless (slower than dialup). Also the rooms are only made up weekly so you have to ask for new coffee or exchange your towels at the front desk (normal for this chain), and be careful about your trash because they only give you one tiny little wastebasket. But if this hotel is at the lower price range when you're searching, it's definitely a bargain,

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: ibkfla
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautifully kept, clean and friendly! My family and I will be staying again. We give it an A+ and recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: 5626familytravel
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean. The staff was pleasant. It is right on the beach. However parking is minimal. Other guests where loud. We also had to get our own towels in the lobby when we requested extra. The hotel is small but the price is right would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Getting More For Your Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was absolutely great! You can't find a 4-star hotel for $79.00 a night and get the quality we received. We searched hundreds of hotels on the internet and there are no other hotels in Daytona that offers a beautifully decorated suite w/ a fully equipped kitchen thats clean, comfortable and smells good. The staff was awesome. They made you feel so welcomed. They are courteous, professional and genuinely friendly; not fakes like a lot of the hotels I have stayed at. I challenge anyone to find a better deal. Most 4-star hotels at a discount start around $149-$250 a night. I was very pleased and will always seek to stay at Studio Plus whenever possible when I travel. Ms. Wiggins

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic! It is very close to Daytona Speedway. Staff was super friendly and accomodating. Room was clean, had everything we needed. Would definatly stay here everytime!

HotelInfo.Name: Extended Stay Deluxe - Daytona Beach - International Speedway
HotelInfo.Address: 255 Bill France Blvd, Daytona Beach, FL 32114 (Formerly Studio Plus)
